p: The principles for vascular anastomosis: (1) Both arteries and veins should be anastomosed by vein-first surgical technique; (2) The vessel stumps should be trimmed into an oblique section, after which continuous suture could be performed from the posterior wall of the vessel stumps using a 7-0 polypropylene thread ( Figures 2A,B); (3) No additional suture on the stumps unless obvious bleeding after reperfusion; (4) Sufficient drainage in the abdominal cavity.
